alert.note: Alert for Cowley (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 1:43PM CDT until May 06 at 8:30AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of South Central and Southeast Kansas, including the following counties, in South Central Kansas, Butler and Cowley. In Southeast Kansas, Chautauqua, Elk, Greenwood, Labette, Montgomery, Neosho and Wilson. * WHEN...Until 100 AM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 111 PM CDT, emergency management and gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring. Between 3 and 5.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. This warning will replace the previous flood warnings across Butler, Cowley, Chautauqua, Elk, Greenwood, Labette, Montgomery, Neosho and Wilson counties. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... El Dorado, Arkansas City, Winfield, Andover, Parsons, Coffeyville, Independence, Augusta, Rose Hill, Eureka, Neodesha, Fredonia, Cherryvale, Caney, Oswego, Douglass, Towanda, Erie, Chetopa and Sedan. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown.
